file_content.text: I am improved.
My attacker's weapon... another Jedi?
No. He was a Sith Lord, corrupted by the dark side of the Force.
A Sith, not a Jedi.
My order walks a peaceful path. But the Sith, like your attacker, think nothing of harming others.
No Jedi would hurt you.
That Sith was a backstabbing coward. I'm nothing like that.
Don't compare me to him.
I saw you ease his death.
It's what makes us better than the Empire.
His death was necessary.
We're in a war; we can't afford to be nice to our enemies.
My journey is not right. My visions should begin, to make me wise.
Every Force-aware culture has trials. Perhaps this is how the Force prepares a Mystic.
The Force may be testing you.
Your Force is yours. I am Voss.
Do you actually believe your visions will make you a great leader overnight?
You think it's that easy?
Why would I not?
My order achieves insight and knowledge through hard work.
The Jedi earn their wisdom.
Visions are hard work.
E--enough. Pilgrimage--I must contemplate a stone carving at the holy grounds.
A potential who contemplates receives a sign. Guidance. I will need protection.
I take it these holy grounds are dangerous.
Protection from what?
Gormak defile the grounds.
I promise you will not be harmed again.
You have it.
More Voss nonsense. Fine.
The carving was broken. First, we gather the pieces.
I speak with healers. Go. Rest. Call on your device when all is ready.
A sign to guide me. Soon, my first vision.
Gaden-Ko grows weak.
Outsider, be prepared. We begin.
Pain feeds on pain, Jedi.
I thought you were unconscious.
Gaden-Ko?
What am I seeing?
I belong to Gaden-Ko.
Whatever you are, I will not be intimidated.
Don't threaten me.
I do not threaten, only speak for Gaden-Ko.
I am the part of Gaden-Ko that suffers and must be healed.
Pain feeds on pain. You know this, from battling the Empire. So, how does one cope with the tyrant? Or the scalpel?
I'm sure if we talk, an agreement can be reached.
Can we negotiate?
And while words are exchanged, the tyrant destroys, the wound festers untreated.
Resisting the tyrant reveals his weaknesses. Enduring the scalpel leads to healing.
We stand firm against it.
Yes. Endurance leads to insight, and strength.
Your understanding will make this exchange easier.
Pain only ends when we struggle against it.
By fighting back.
Causing the tyrant to oppress further? Or the scalpel to slip?
Your understanding is flawed. I cannot make this exchange any easier for you.
The treatment is complete. Gaden-Ko's recovery begins.
Sacrifice for a soft thing? Must think highly of boy, Herald.
Hmph. I suppose, sometimes, spiritual idiocy truly is the best medicine.
Please be okay. Blast, I knew I should have done this.
Sit down or something, you're white as a sheet.
All finished?
You look so tired. It's my fault, it should have been me.
It's over. You should take a minute before we go anywhere.
Impressive. Gaden-Ko is stronger for this. Here, to aid your recovery.
If the candidate is prepared, we begin.
Aaarrrgh! Claws tear, but--I am hunter. I... will stand!
Take a moment, make sure you're alright.
Are you okay?
Am no soft thing, Herald! Is fine.
The Scorekeeper sees your resilience, Qyzen, and so do I.
You coped extremely well.
Is... good thing you say.
I thought Trandoshans could lose entire limbs without screaming.
You shame your species.
Is other pain, of mind and soul. True Herald would understand.
Huh. This isn't too... too... aaarrrgh!
We can break off the healing if it hurts.
You want to stop?
No, don't! It's working, I can tell.
Hold on. I'm here, you're almost through it.
Stay with me, Felix.
I'm alright. Hearing your voice helps.
Failure is not an option, Lieutenant. Stay on your feet.
Don't give up, soldier!
I'm good, it's fading. Does your shielding technique feel this painful?
Maybe you've neglected your physical training for too long.
Getting soft, Lieutenant?
You know, for such a beautiful woman, you've got a real ugly side.
I did this for Gaden-Ko, so skip the attitude, all right?
Uhh! No. Pain is a word. Pain is a word.
Stay strong, Zenith, it's almost over.
Hold on, you'll be alright.
Doing my best.
If saying that phrase is helping you, keep going.
Does that work?
Worked on an Imperial torture table, it'll work now.
Refusing to admit you're hurting won't impress anyone.
Don't be so stoic.
Shut up and let me handle it.
The pain--it's burning me up, I... uhh!
Remember, the Force flows through you. There is no chaos, only harmony.
Let the Force help you.
Harmony. Only harmony. Yes, that's better. Thank you.
Enough. I won't let you suffer!
I'm stopping this, now.
I'm alright, just--be with me for a minute.
Hold on. A little more and Gaden-Ko is safe.
Be strong, Nadia.
I can do this. I can do it.
Jedi younger than you endure far worse in their trials.
Act like a Padawan!
B--but--I apologize, Master. I will not disappoint you again.
It is done. A successful treatment. See to your friend, Gaden-Ko will wake soon.
We begin. Asha-Mu, ready yourself.
Ahh--aaarrrgh!
Stop the procedure. Immediately.
Enough, you're killing her!
I didn't realize the healing would be this painful.
Is this normal?
You were planning to subject me to this torture?
I'm glad I refused this.
S--success. I felt it. But my hands, my fingertips... numb. I feel nothing.
Are these ill effects permanent?
Will it pass?
Perhaps. Perhaps not.
I'm sorry, but it was to help Gaden-Ko.
This was necessary.
Don't complain. He's alive.
All must balance. But....
A successful treatment. Gaden-Ko's recovery begins. We must see to Asha-Mu.
Leave when you wish, outsider. Go well.
I am Orin-Va. Asha-Mu. Gaden-Ko is our patient.
His treatment was delayed. The poison spreads.
You acted quickly, but the poison eats at him.
We require another, of great mental or physical strength, to purge it.
What would you need from this person?
By doing what?
There is no gain without loss.
If there's anything I can do for Gaden-Ko, just ask.
I want to help.
We need you.
Do what you must, and let me know when Gaden-Ko is better.
I'm not getting involved.
Gaden-Ko is dying. We cannot delay.
Healing takes life from one to save another. Painful, survivable. You appear worthy.
Your friend also seems worthy. Gaden-Ko is fortunate. Will you take the risk, outsiders?
Pour strength into weakness? Strange world.
The Scorekeeper would smile upon such a sacrifice, Qyzen.
Qyzen, will you do this?
Do not speak for Scorekeeper. Boy must endure alone, or die.
Is great thing to ask of hunter. But you are Herald. I trust.
How do you find people gullible enough to swallow this nonsense?
He needs "physical or mental strength," Tharan. And you are a genius.
Please, Tharan. Help him.
Absolutely not! I won't indulge this pseudo-medical... drivel.
Tharan, you're so commanding when you're cross.
Take the boy to an actual medical professional, otherwise leave me out of this.
If Gaden-Ko was fortunate, we wouldn't be here.
Your strength of will can withstand anything.
You could help him, Zenith.
No. You failed to guard him, you clean up the mess.
Outsider. You are Gaden-Ko's last chance, will you help?
I must, if no one else will.
Fine by me. Might even work.
Wait, you can't, you're too important. I'll do it.
My training and connection to the Force make me the logical choice.
No. I'm the best candidate.
Logic's not really what I'm--okay. But if it's too much, say "stop."
I want you by my side and in one piece.
You're important to me.
I can take it, and I'm not a key part of the mission. I volunteer.
You make a good point, Felix. Go ahead.
I agree.
Glad we're on the same page. So, what do I do?
Gaden-Ko can't die like this; it's not right.
A Republic soldier saving a potential Mystic would send a powerful message to the Voss.
Felix, you'd be perfect.
Spare me the pitch. I'll do this--but for Gaden-Ko, not you.
Right. You handle the spiritual stuff, just tell me what to do.
Let me do it. Please, I don't... want you to be hurt.
I have my Jedi training and the Force to sustain me.
I won't be. I'll do it.
Well... all right, but if anything funny happens, I'm putting a stop to it.
I can't let you risk yourself for me.
I don't want you hurt, either.
I fought by myself at Attis Station. If you're with me, I can do anything.
If you truly want to do this, Nadia, I won't stop you.
All right.
But I fought--what? Oh. Good! Then it's settled.
We have to do something.
Your Force abilities are incredible, maybe strong enough to save him.
I hate to ask, Nadia....
You won't even try, will you? Fine, I'll help poor Gaden-Ko.
To help Gaden-Ko? Sure, I'll do it. I'm not scared.
Come to Gaden-Ko's room when you are both ready.
Would you risk your life to save a Voss, outsider?
I accept the dangers, for Gaden-Ko's sake.
I will do this.
All right. I hope he appreciates this.
Just this once.
You're young, obviously powerful. A perfect candidate.
Why don't you do it, Asha-Mu?
I am unworthy of the honor.
I will do what you refuse to.
Then it falls to me.
Come to Gaden-Ko's room when you are ready, outsider.
As his healer and a fellow Voss, you're more suitable than some outsider.
You're the better choice.
For the good of your society, you can't let a potential Mystic die.
But it's your duty, as a Voss.
Truth is spoken.
This is logic. I will be the candidate.
Meet us in Gaden-Ko's room when you are ready, outsider.
But without you, the Crisis Worlds fall apart. And... so would I. Nobody wants to see that.
Are you okay?
Are you okay?
